decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):  19/45/RRS/102 EXISTING ELEVATIONS
19/45/RRS/103/A1 PROPOSED GROUND FLOOR PLAN, FIRST FLOOR PLAN AND BLOCK PLAN, SITE LOCATION PLAN, 19/45/RRS/104/A2 PROPOSED ELEVATIONS
19/45/RRS/101/A EXISTING GROUND FLOOR PLAN, FIRST FLOOR PLAN AND BLOCK PLAN.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, kitchen/dining/living/bath and shower rooms above/below bedrooms of separate dwellings and staircase adjoining bedrooms. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason - To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing SPG10.

| Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of bins, the location of storage and the materials for the store. The approved storage shall be brought into use prior to the first use of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of the stores, the location of the stores and the materials for the store. The approved storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to first occupation of either of the approved flats the works to demolish the existing canopy and to partially demolish the existing outbuilding shall be carried out in their entirety, and all resultant debris removed from the site.

Reason: To protect residential amenity and living conditions of furture occupants, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Conversion of house into two self-contained flats; removal of canopy and reduction in size of existing outbuilding.
